title: Eval: help-usage count for agent scenarios
description: Add an eval harness that runs real CLI scenarios and scores how many times an agent needed to invoke help (-h/--help/help) to reach a successful invocation. Should support running with and without prior 'known-good' memory to measure ackchyually impact.
notes: Implemented helpcount eval harness (cmd/ackchyually-eval + internal/eval/helpcount) running git/go scenarios in baseline vs memory modes; counts help invocations (-h/--help/help) from the SQLite log; added just target eval-helpcount + EVALS.md docs. Also broadened shim usage detection to include 'unrecognized argument' and 'invalid option' so git flag typos trigger suggestions. Merged in PR #11: https://github.com/joelklabo/ackchyually/pull/11

title: Eval: expand helpcount and fix discovered bugs
description: Use the helpcount harness to shake out product + eval issues (missed usage-ish detection patterns, suggestion selection under noise, help invocation counting accuracy). DoD: add failing scenarios that reproduce bugs; fix ackchyually/harness; keep PTY tests passing; update eval docs.
notes:
Found via helpcount:
- go test unknown flag (-cunt=1) prints usage to STDOUT with 'flag provided but not defined' + 'Usage of ...' so isUsageish missed it.
- suggestions picked the most recent success (noise like 'git status'/'go env') instead of the closest known-good.
- ListSuccessCandidates/best broke because invocations.created_at was stored with monotonic clock text; scan/parsing failed.
Fixes:
- isUsageish now checks stdout+stderr+combined and includes Go flag patterns.
- suggest/auto-exec pick best known-good via token overlap + prefix score.
- invocations.created_at stored as RFC3339Nano; candidates parse time robustly.
Merged in PR #13: https://github.com/joelklabo/ackchyually/pull/13

title: Eval: expand helpcount scenarios + keep hunting bugs
description: Continue using the helpcount eval harness to discover remaining 'usage-ish' detection gaps and suggestion-quality issues. Add scenarios that reproduce missed patterns (e.g. 'requires a value/argument', cobra 'Run ... --help for usage', missing required args), fix ackchyually/harness, keep PTY tests passing, and update Beads notes.
notes:
Found via helpcount:
- git commit -m (missing value) prints 'requires a value' without 'usage', so isUsageish missed it.
- go <unknown> prints 'unknown command' + 'Run ... for usage', also missed.
- After tightening suggestion selection to avoid noise, unknown-command typos had zero token overlap (e.g. tset vs test), so no suggestion.
Fixes:
- isUsageish now includes 'requires a value/argument', 'unknown command/subcommand', and 'for usage'.
- Suggestion selection now does limited fuzzy token matching for short word-like args (1 edit / transposition / single insert) so subcommand typos still map to the right known-good command.
- Added scenarios: git_commit_missing_value + go_unknown_command.
Merged in PR #15: https://github.com/joelklabo/ackchyually/pull/15
